div.head: TO THE LEARNED AND CONSIDERATE READER. Lege, Perge, Perlege.
div.p:
I Intreat fauour, that you will reade me: & fauour, that you will regard mee. Reade therefore and regard, for so you will adde some grace in the reading: and reade with delight, if it bee with regarding. Conniue a little, & so you may indulgeate my hopes. I haue in many places of this worke, rather lost my Rime, then my Reason. It is worthy of your pardon, because I confesse my fault. As for the ignorant and inconsiderate,
I will speake to euery one of them no more but thus:
Quem recitas meus est,
Sed recitando tuus.
And so commending this my late-borne issue, to bee fostered vnder your fauours, and expecting you will Socraticam dare veniam, in respect of my now aged weakenesse, I rest

closer.signed: A poore well-wisher to the Muses, RO: TISDALE.
